title: ADCs are 'too weak' and Riot is planning buffs.
body:
Oh heres a crazy idea instead of 'buffing underperforming ADCs' how about you FUCKING LOWER THE FUCKING DAMAGE IN THIS GAME. Considering the reason half the ADC roster is shit is because of utterly stupid high levels of burst damage in this game and in order to compete in this stupid fucking meta you need mobility or insane burst. 

After promising to look into damage this preseason Riot did absolutely nothing, what a fucking shock. Instead here we go again increasing the damage on underperforming champions to further the damage creep.

You're not being honest about any of this.

Previous last whisper was more powerful, and also cheaper, than both of the current versions we have. At its strongest it was 40% pen for (roughly) 2,400 gold.

Secondly, current cleaver is only stronger if you're Darius. Original cleaver (well, after they reworked it from being an attack speed item) stacked faster (5 stacks instead of 6), stacked harder (6.25% armor pen per stack instead of 5, which means you'd get a STRONGER effect FASTER), granted more AD (50 vs 40, 20% more), granted flat armor pen (10), and has a build path which only benefits bruisers (phage + kindlegem). It was the perfect assassin item in every way, and it was changed to a beefy brawler item; because THOSE are the champions who generally have to fight and kill tanks.

Thirdly, old ghost blade was also stronger. 65 AD as opposed to 55, an active which increased attack speed, 20 flat armor pen (that's more -flat- pen than the current one gives in lethality...). It was objectively stronger in every way, and it also cost less gold (2700 vs 2900) than it does now!

And lastly, brutalizer. Brutalizer was the underlying issue for assassin itemization, because for 1337 gold you got 25 AD, 10% CDR, and 10 armor pen. You could semi reliably get it on your first back, and always on your second.

All told, an assassin with brut + ghostblade + cleaver would have 40 flat armor pen from itemization, CDR cap, and after 5 hits they'd ignore 31.25% of your total armor. They'd also pick up Last Whisper, which was another 40% reduction. I can't remember the EXACT number, but if you had less than 150 (or so) armor they'd just straight up deal true damage.

Oh, and you could also get like. 16ish flat armor pen from runes. So there's that too.

Don't pretend that lethality is broken. It's not. It's much, MUCH weaker than old armor penetration itemization was, and everyone who complains about it is viewing the past with rose colored glasses. As someone who loves to play tanky champions, s3 and s4 were the worst experiences I've ever had in league: Physical damage dealers would build last whisper second items, and just about anyone could assassinate a tank in a couple of hits. It was so bad that armor was straight up garbage, if you wanted to tank damage you had to build health and items which protected in ways other than armor (frozen heart's attack speed slow, for example).

You're thinking too far back. In s4 or s5 they changed drake to a single 'elemental', where you'd get a different bonus (what elemental drakes give) for each time you killed it. Just going to copy the wowwiki on it here:

Killing the DragonSquare Dragon nows grants a permanent stacking buff called Dragon Slayer buff Dragon Slayer:
DRAGON'S MIGHT (1 stack): +8% total attack damage and ability power.
DRAGON'S DOMINANCE (2 stacks): +15% damage to minions and monsters.
DRAGON'S FLIGHT (3 stacks): +5% movement speed.
DRAGON'S WRATH (4 stacks): +15% damage to turrets and buildings.
ASPECT OF THE DRAGON (5 stacks, repeatable): Doubles all other bonuses and your attacks burn enemies for 150 true damage over 5 seconds. Lasts 180 seconds.

It's worth noting that this was during the time of armor pen and all that. So you'd have assassins running around with 50+ flat pen, 60-70%ish (% shred is multiplied, not flatly added) pen ontop of that, items which gave MORE AD, and then a drake which further boosted their total AD by 8% (but it all counted as bonus AD).

Seriously, you guys think Zed is strong now? The dude used to be able to R full build tanks, stick to them  for 1-2 seconds, and then have his ulti finish them off. Big beefy mother fuckers with around 4k hp, 300 armor, and tank steroids. That was NORMAL back then.

Problem: almost all the new damage is conditional whereas the old runes and masteries offered general and scaling power.

1) No more tree bonus to stats, so that 12 AD at the start is gone.  

2) Dark Harvest is easy to proc, but everyone agrees that it’s an aberration, since Electrocute requires landing three hits.  

3) 18 AD from Eyeball Collection is only if you stack it, which you can’t when the game starts and stat advantages matter most.

4) Lethality or Magic Penetration from Sudden Impact requires using a dash first.  You often can’t spam that ability in lane.

5) 7% against targets under 40% is about 5% against targets under 50%.

6) You won’t necessarily take Cheap Shot or Scorch, but you would take the shards.

In other words, an AD assassin now falls off harder than before, with no scaling damage or penetration, and has smaller windows of power and almost exclusively against champions.  That’s the opposite of damage creep.
